description: Brazil Finance Minister Fernando Haddad expressed concern about the country’s fiscal outlook during a Friday afternoon meeting with investors, tanking assets and sparking a public attempt to contain the damage.
title: Brazil Finance Chief Remarks Fuel Fiscal Worries, Roiling Assets

description: Keir Starmer’s Labour party vowed to “level the playing field” between high street and online retailers by overhauling UK business rates — a property tax on commercial premises — if it’s voted into power at next month’s general election.
title: Labour Party Plans to Overhaul UK Business Rates to Help Small Firms

description: The governing Conservatives said they will reverse the expansion of London’s clean air zone — which imposes a charge on polluting vehicles — if they hang on to power at next month’s General Election.
title: UK’s Tories Vow to Reverse London Clean Air Zone Expansion

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Biden Invokes the Lessons of WWII for 2024 as Presidential Election Looms

description: Cabinet minister Penny Mordaunt said it was “very wrong” of Rishi Sunak to leave Thursday’s D-Day commemorations in Normandy early, strongly criticizing her own leader in the latest UK election debate, as Reform UK Party leader Nigel Farage sought to capitalize on the prime minister’s gaffe by calling him unpatriotic.
title: Sunak Criticized for D-Day Gaffe by Tory Mordaunt in TV Debate

description: Ukraine’s war is changing how the US prepares for conflict. On the Big Take, the very old ammunition that’s proving surprisingly effective on the battlefield.
title: Ukraine’s Frontline Fight Is Changing How the US Prepares for War

description: Denmark’s prime minister, Mette Frederiksen, was struck by an unidentified attacker in the capital city of Copenhagen.
title: Denmark’s Prime Minister Struck in Copenhagen, Attacker Arrested

description: French President Emmanuel Macron said he aims to put together a coalition in the coming days to send military instructors to Ukraine as Kyiv needs to train tens of thousands of new soldiers to repel Russia’s invasion.
title: Macron Aims to Finalize Coalition to Send Instructors to Ukraine

description: NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg is scrapping plans to set up a five-year fund of military aid for Ukraine after facing pushback from alliance members, and is instead asking countries to keep up their current contributions, people familiar with the matter said.
title: NATO Scales Back Road Map for Ukraine Aid Plan After Pushback

description: Key Square Group LP founder Scott Bessent, a prominent Donald Trump fundraiser, sharply criticized Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen, accusing her of using the department to bolster President Joe Biden by juicing the economy ahead of the election.
title: Trump Ally Bessent Says Yellen Using Post to Aid Biden 2024 Bid

description: The Labour Party signed off on its election manifesto at a crunch meeting of party and union officials on Friday — but failed to win the backing of Unite, one of the biggest trade unions affiliated to the UK party, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Labour Approves UK Election Pledges - But One Union Objects

description: President-elect Claudia Sheinbaum will foster discussions on a series of constitutional reforms that have alarmed investors and business leaders in Mexico, according to a top adviser.
title: Claudia Sheinbaum’s Government Will Seek Consensus in Congress, Ally Says

description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken returns to the Middle East next week in a bid to keep alive a cease-fire proposal between Israel and Hamas even though both sides have distanced themselves from it.
title: Blinken Returns to Mideast as Latest Cease-Fire Plan Stalls

description: The Biden administration is buying six million more barrels for the nation’s oil reserve as it continues to take advantage of a dip in prices to refill the depleted cache.
title: Biden Seeks Six Million More Barrels for Reserve as Prices Drop

description: Venezuelan inflation slowed to a 10-year low as the central bank intervenes to absorb excess liquidity.
title: Venezuelan Inflation Slows to a 10-Year Low of 59% Ahead of Vote

description: US Supreme Court justices reported collecting a total of $1.5 million in book income last year, according to financial disclosures that showed they also received pricey photo albums, payment for work on an animated television show and Beyonce concert tickets.
title: Supreme Court Justices Disclose Bali Trip, Beyonce Tickets and Book Royalties

description: The Pentagon focused on high-tech weapons after the Soviet Union fell, but the invasion of Ukraine has set off a race to revive output of time-tested munitions
title: America’s War Machine Can’t Make Basic Artillery Fast Enough

description: President Joe Biden called on Americans to defend freedom and democracy, drawing an implicit contrast with Republican Donald Trump by invoking the heroism of US Army Rangers who scaled the cliffs of Pointe Du Hoc on D-Day to take out a Nazi position.
title: Biden Touts Democracy at Famed D-Day Site, Tacitly Hitting Trump

description: Labour is expected to commit to passing new laws on football governance in its UK general election manifesto due to be published next week, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Labour to Commit to Football Governance Laws in UK Manifesto

description: Hi there, welcome to The Readout. Until the general election on July 4, The Readout will be co-written by Allegra Stratton and Ailbhe Rea alongside other colleagues from the newsroom, giving you extra perspective and analysis as the campaigns unfurl.
title: Allegra Stratton and Ailbhe Rea: Sunak’s Apology and Labour’s Crunch Moment

description: The US government moved closer to imposing new tariffs on solar cells and panels from Southeast Asia after an agency’s initial determination that American manufacturers are being harmed by cheap imports from the region.
title: US Moves Closer to Tariffs on Asia Solar Panels With Vote

description: The US military aims to increase the pace of aid deliveries into Gaza via a temporary pier when shipments resume in the coming days.
title: US Aims to Increase Gaza Aid Deliveries Via Temporary Pier After Repairs

description: Federal prosecutors rested their case Friday against President Joe Biden’s son, Hunter, during a trial in Delaware on charges he illegally bought a gun while addicted to drugs.
title: Hunter Biden Prosecutors Rest Their Case in Gun Trial

description: The Conservative Party is losing support from some in the business and finance communities. Several say they will back Reform UK.
title: Conservative Donors Flirt With Farage as Fight for UK Election Money Heats Up

description: Germany is considering sending a fourth Patriot air-defense missile battery to Ukraine as allies struggle to deliver equipment that Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy has urgently requested to fend off Russia’s fresh assault.
title: Germany Weighs Sending Ukraine Fourth Patriot Air-Defense System

description: A group of international creditors began closed talks with Ukraine this week, as the two sides work to prevent the country from defaulting on its $20 billion in international debt while it fends off an invasion by Russia.
title: Ukraine, Bondholders in Restricted Talks for $20 Billion Rework

description: South Africa is in political limbo after May 29 elections failed to produce an outright majority.
title: South Africa’s ANC Wants to Lead a Unity Government. Will Rivals Play Along?

description: A senior adviser to Argentine President Javier Milei expects the administration to announce significant investments from technology companies within the next eight weeks after visiting Silicon Valley in May.
title: Milei Adviser Expects Major Tech Investments Within Eight Weeks

description: Help is on the way for European carmakers struggling to deal with an influx of cheap Chinese electric vehicles. The European Commission is preparing to impose tariffs on EVs imported from China after an investigation into subsidies that Beijing doles out to its car industry. The duties are expected to hurt companies including BYD Co., SAIC Motor Corp. and Geely, but also risk affecting Western manufacturers that ship cars made at their Chinese factories to Europe — for example Tesla Inc. and BMW
title: Europe Readies Tariffs on Flood of Cheap Chinese EVs

description: Chile’s President Gabriel Boric will bring his clean energy pitch to Europe as he works to keep the country at the forefront of the global green transition.
title: Chile President Gabriel Boric Puts Clean Energy at Center of Key Trip to Europe

description: South Africa’s leftist Economic Freedom Fighters won’t join a government that includes the centrist opposition Democratic Alliance, the party’s deputy leader said. The rand strengthened.
title: South African Leftist EFF Rejects Governing With Pro-Business DA

description: President Joe Biden announced a new $225 million aid package for Ukraine during a meeting with his counterpart, Volodymyr Zelenskiy, and pledged continued US support as Kyiv looks to turn the tide in the war with Russia.
title: Biden Gives Zelenskiy $225 Million in Aid, Apologizes for Delay

description: The Dutch Defense Ministry is investing €54 million ($58.8 million) to boost its military drones production capacity to help Ukraine, according to State Secretary of Defense Christophe van der Maat.
title: Netherlands to Spend €54 Million for More Drones to Aid Ukraine

description: Viktor Orban’s cabinet is the only one in Europe made up of only men. For the rank and file in the Hungarian prime minister’s ruling party, there are now even fewer women waiting in the wings.
title: Orban Sidelines Another Woman in Hungary’s Man-Heavy Politics

description: German Deputy Finance Minister Florian Toncar said that the European Union’s joint borrowing push to finance its €750 billion Next Generation EU program mustn’t become the norm — or the bloc might lose its credibility on the capital markets.
title: NextGenEU’s Joint Borrowing Can’t Become Norm, Toncar Says

description: Finland’s pro-business government, led by Prime Minister Petteri Orpo, survived a vote of no confidence in parliament brought by opposition groups over its climate policies.
title: Finnish Cabinet Survives Confidence Vote Over Climate Policies

description: Keir Starmer’s Labour Party has extended its lead over Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s governing Conservatives ahead of the July 4 general election.
title: Labour Extends Lead to 22.3 Points, Bloomberg Polling Composite Finds

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: The Spread of Middle East Turmoil Is a Risk to Biden

description: Germany may purchase 10 additional F-35 fighter jets from U.S. defense manufacturer Lockheed Martin Corp. on top of the 35 units it ordered shortly after Russia’s full-scale military invasion of Ukraine, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Germany Is in Talks to Buy 10 Additional F-35 Fighter Jets

description: The prospect of a fresh round of tax cuts next year is helping Donald Trump woo Wall Street donors but threatens to add trillions of dollars to the national debt.
title: Trump Tax Cut Renewal Is Winning Wall Street, But Could Cost $4.6 Trillion

description: The most prominent official in the European Union, Ursula von der Leyen, is bullish about her chances to be re-appointed as president of the bloc’s executive arm as polls begin to open across the bloc.
title: EU’s Von der Leyen Says She’s ‘Confident’ of Retaining Post as Voting Begins

description: Ireland’s finance ministry must not fan the flames of inflation as it heads into a budgetary cycle, the central bank has warned.
title: Irish Budget Must Not Fuel Inflation, Central Bank Cautions

description: Foreign countries are “afraid” of Chinese electric vehicles, BYD Co. Chairman Wang Chuanfu said in a swipe at European and US efforts to constrain imports of China-made cars.
title: Europe, US Fearful of Chinese Electric Cars, Says BYD Founder

description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak apologized for leaving commemorations of the 80th anniversary of D-Day in France early to return to the UK for a television interview.
title: Sunak Apologizes for Skipping D-Day Event to Return to UK

description: The prospect of quieter politics and a continued economic recovery after the UK’s election on July 4 should keep consumer confidence and the retail sector on track, strategists say.
title: Traders See Consumer Optimism Surviving Vote

description: Traders added bets on more rand losses after the African National Congress said it will look to form a government of national unity after losing its parliamentary majority.
title: Bearish Rand Bets Rise on ANC’s South Africa Government Plan

description: Bank of Russia Governor Elvira Nabiullina is helping keep Russia’s war economy on the rails but increasingly finds herself out-of-step with the government over key policies.
title: Putin’s Wartime Central Banker Tells Him What He Doesn’t Want to Hear

description: The UK has struggled to turn clever science and technology ideas into larger companies under the Tories.
title: British Startups Just Can't Seem to Scale

description: A lack of funding for environmental protection has wreaked havoc on the country’s waterways.
title: Tories Handed England an Awful Sewage Problem

description: Sahra Wagenknecht founded her own pro-Russia party in January and is draining support from the far-right AfD
title: Frightened Germans Turn to Anti-War Party Amid Wave of Political Violence

description: The leader of Mexico’s ruling party in the lower house said that the bloc will be “very prudent” about taking advantage of its strong lead in congress amid concerns it may speed through legislation before President-elect Claudia Sheinbaum takes office.
title: Mexico Ruling Party Says It Will Respect Legislative Process

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has accepted an invitation to address a joint meeting of the US House and Senate on July 24, House Speaker Mike Johnson’s office announced on Thursday night.
title: Netanyahu Invited to Address Both Houses of Congress on July 24

description: Mexico City’s Finance Chief Luz Elena Gonzalez stepped down from her role to join the transition team of President-elect Claudia Sheinbaum.
title: Mexico City Finance Chief to Join Sheinbaum’s Transition Team
